subject: Promlem in writing Test case
msgSnippet: Hi All I am writing a test case in JUnit. The original class GetInfo.java has a method. String getSystemVersion(String str) which is under test. This method is
messageBody:
Hi All
I am writing a test case in JUnit. The original class GetInfo.java has a method. String getSystemVersion(String str) which is under test. This method is supplied with path variable in form of string from where it reads a xml file to get certain data and return back to the user.

The point of confussion for me is to how to test the method. What should be the actual and expected result. Meaning for getting the expected result I will have to use the same logic as it is in the main code, if I use the same logic to read the xml file then the assert statement would not be meaningful as then the expected and actual results would be same.

Find the code snippet below

<snippet>

public String getVersion(String path) throws Exception
{
String verFolder = "";
String sPathTemp = "";
String sPrevVersion = "";
String currVersion = "";
/* Return version computed previously. No need to compute it again*/
if(version != null)
{
return version;
}
String oldConfigFile = path;
config = new XMLHelper();
oldConfigFile += filesep + "ICServicePacks";
File fe =new File(oldConfigFile);
if(!fe.exists())
{
version="0";
return version;
}
String sDirList[]=fe.list();
/*
* As per the architecture of PI there will only be one directory inside ICServicePacks folder
* with other two files install.log and version.xml
* Hence cheking for the folder inside ICServicePacks folder
*/
for(int counter = 0;counter < sDirList.length; counter++)
{
fe = new File(oldConfigFile + filesep + sDirList[counter]);
if(fe.isDirectory()== true)
{
verFolder = sDirList[counter];
sPathTemp = oldConfigFile + filesep + verFolder + filesep + "Record" + filesep + "config.xml";
if(new File(sPathTemp).exists())
{
if(config.init(sPathTemp)== true)
{
currVersion = config.getValueFromNodenameAndAttrib("System","Version");
if(sPrevVersion.compareToIgnoreCase(currVersion) < 0)
{
sPrevVersion = config.getValueFromNodenameAndAttrib("System","Version");
version = sPrevVersion;
}
}
}
}
}
if(version == null)
{
version = "0";
}
return version;
}
}

</snippet>

Thanks in Advance

-Avinash
